attributes.review:
Oh for goodness sake! Trying to keep an open mind, but am repeatedly distracted by the repetitive attempted wallet grabs. Iâ€™m sure political campaigns cost gobs and gobs of money, but... really? This is quite a â€œpushyâ€ ask. 

Been through the app carefully, but still just donâ€™t get it. Was hoping to hear more about causes that matter to me - and lots of my friends - but actual content in here is pretty much non existent. I come from a family and background thatâ€™s pretty data and fact driven, and this is no where close.

Really had to rethink the entire premise of this app: itâ€™s just not providing any information, super light on that whole fact checking thing, and not even half as entertaining as Candy Crush - and yes thatâ€™s complete sarcasm. 

Shouldnâ€™t an app provide relevance, data or compelling validation? I certainly hoped so, but this was an utter disappointment. If this is the best this campaign can do (seriously - are they completely relying on only people who donâ€™t think at all??? ) well, thereâ€™s no reason to keep this on my phone.

Utterly disappointing, and one cannot help but pity the poor developers that ended up with this as a project. Canâ€™t blame them for the drivel, and hope they were provided with sufficient compensation. We all need to pay the bills. 

Bottom line: if youâ€™re looking for any reason to stay as a supporter ... well, youâ€™re simply not going to find anything at all here. If all you want is an excuse to throw more money this way - youâ€™ve hit the mother of all home runs.

Yup, deleted. And rethinking a whole lot of ideas.
